newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - SRW wheat firm, corn, soy steady.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - SRW wheat firm, corn, soy steady.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf soft red winter wheat basis values rose Monday largely to offset declines in the CBOT soft red winter wheat futures, grain dealers said.
Corn and soybean basis values were unchanged, with dealers reporting a lack of activity in cash markets.

Exports markets were quiet. Except for a Wednesday tender by Taiwan Sugar Corp for 10,000 tonnes of U.S. corn for June shipment, there was little scheduled export demand for corn or soybeans, dealers said.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
FH April unq + K nc +27 + K unc
LH April unq + K nc +26 + K unc
May unq + K nc +25 + K unc
June unq + N nc +25 + N unc
July unq + N nc +25 + N unc
Note: K=CBOT May, N=CBOT July, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
FH April unq + K nc +27 + K unc
LH April unq + K nc +26 + K unc
May unq + K nc +26 + K unc
June unq + N nc +27 + N unc
July unq + N nc +28 + N unc
Note K=CBOT May, N=CBOT July, nc=no comparison
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
March unq nc +38 + K up 3
April unq nc +38 + K up 3
July unq nc +18 + N unc
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
March unq unc +68 + K unc
April unq unc +60 + K unc
July unq unc +45 + N unc
Note: K=May futures. N=July futures.
((Chicago newsdesk 312-408-8720))
